story:
Can you be another person's fate? The year is 1953. Two strangers meet at midnight in a run down empty bar. Max has left the war, and Joy has left her husband. Their night together has all the makings of a classic boy-meets-girl love story. But Max has a secret up his sleeve—a shocking revelation that unearths a painful history they may not be able to endure. Now, before the sun comes up, these two unlikely soul mates will struggle to find hope in the face of unthinkable grief. Inspired by true events, The Second Sun is an uncommon love story of endurance and survival.

To purchase tickets to The Second Sun, visit this link: http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/1701828

Over the past year, The Second Sun, has enjoyed a number of very successful workshops. 

Now, we have been accepted into the Thespis Theater Festival and will be playing at the Hudson Guild Theater on September the 8th at 6:15, the 12th at 8:30, and the 13th at 1:00.

This project means a great deal to me. I have been in a lot of plays, and I've never experienced such a moving, humbling response from an audience. Months and months after a workshop, people are still telling me how much the play affected them, and something personal from their lives that it illuminated.

In this world of ever-deepening mistrust and tumult, I think it is incredibly important to tell stories of hope, and family, and endurance--and a chance of getting through the darkness to the light.


Your contributions will help us compensate the actors, the director, and the stage-manager, as well as to afford our rehearsal space, marketing, technical support, costumes, props, and publicity.

 

We really believe in this production, and we aim to give it a longer run Off-Broadway in the near future, so to that end, there is no contribution too large.

But there is also no contribution too small. We would be so thankful for you to support this project in any way you can.


This is a story about people fighting for love, fighting for joy, and fighting to stay alive. 

We would love you to be a part of it!

Thank you for supporting The Second Sun.


Below, you can read about the members of our team:

James Patrick Nelson (actor/playwright) Off-Broadway: Three Sisters with Maggie Gyllenhaal and Peter Sarsgaard, A Midsummer Night's Dream with Bebe Neuwirth and Christina Ricci, Ivanov with Ethan Hawke and Joely Richardson (Classic Stage Company), Rutherford and Son (Mint Theater Company), and The Death of Bessie Smith (New Brooklyn Theater). He was nominated for two Innovative Theater awards for the world premier of Old Familiar Faces in the NY Fringe Festival. Regional Theater: Pericles (Berkeley Repertory Theater), The Group (Actors Theater of Louisville), Duchess of Malfi (Actors' Shakespeare Project), Galileo (Central Square Theatre), The Norman Conquests(Depot Theater), Much Ado About Nothing, The Tempest (Olney Theater), and a year long national tour of Romeo and Juliet, All's Well That Ends Well, and Knight of the Burning Pestle (American Shakespeare Center). Film/TV: "Tin Man" (NBC), "In Between Men" (NYTVF, Launch), "Albatross" (Cannes), and the upcoming "Finer Homes and Gangsters" and "Adam". Education: BFA Boston University and the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Arts. www.jamespatricknelson.com

Eden Epstein (actor): Theater: The Seagull (The Royal Haymarket 
Stage- Masterclass), Speed the Plow (Haymarket Annex), Agnes of God 
(Haymarket Annex), The Glass Menagerie (Haymarket Annex). Film/TV: "In 
Between Men" (NYTVF, Launch), "Alt Lit" (Nerve.com). Education: NYU 
2011-present (B.A. Spring 2015). Training: Haymarket Annex (Jennifer 
Gelfer), Beverly Hills Playhouse (Howie Deutch), Westside School of 
Ballet (Yvonne Mounsey).

Jennifer Gelfer (director) Jennifer Gelfer acts, directs, teaches, and is a private coach to some of the world's finest actors. NYC directing credits include revivals ofBurn This by Lanford Wilson, Four Dogs and a Bone by John Patrick Shanley, and the NY premier of US by Michelle Clunie at Theater Row. Jennifer is the only American to serve as an Associate Member of the Theatre Royal Haymarket on London's West End. She is the Co-Executive Producer and Director of the web series "In Between Men," which has been seen by millions around the world, and has just been picked up by Launch TV. www.jennifergelfer.com

story:
Short Summary

I have been accepted into the 2015 International Actors' Fellowship at Shakespeare's Globe Theatre in London. This program takes place from September 21st to October 12th and is an opportunity for me to connect with artists from all over the world, practice with the team at the Globe, and investigate that unique wooden O and how Shakespeare and his actors built a relationship with their audience. 

Here's a link to the program's website: http://www.shakespearesglobe.com/education/classes-and-courses/summer-courses/international-actors-fellowship

This is a great next step in the journey of my artist training that was ignited by a visit to Shakespeare & Company in 2008 and has continued through the completion of my MFA and Voice Teaching Diploma this spring. 


Why I Shakespeare

Last November I created a show titled “Why I Shakespeare” in which, through my own words and Shakespeare's I gave voice to some of the reasons I feel compelled to develop my skills as an actor, teacher, and coach around the works of William Shakespeare. I wanted to share some of these words with you in hopes of articulating my intentions as I move forward in my training:

I Shakespeare because he lets me know that it’s okay to not think before I speak but simply speak what I feel.

I Shakespeare because he takes his pain & joy and the pain & joy of his community and my pain & joy and the pain & joy of my community and brings us all together. 

I Shakespeare because he gives me the tools to spot when a good argument is covering an unworthy cause in hopes of helping those with a worthy cause make a better argument.

I Shakespeare because he shows me that immortality is possible in the stories we live and leave behind.

I Shakespeare because no matter the limits he pushes me to he always ends up teaching me more about the simplicity of self.

I Shakespeare because everyone at some point is going to have something to say. And you’re going to find yourself standing in from of a crowd of people or maybe just one person. And Shakespeare can help you be bold and truthful, to connect with others, and share your most compelling self.

I want to save the world, but I don’t have superpowers.  What I do have, is Shakespeare.  The works of William Shakespeare explore the full spectrum of the human experience, allowing me, as an actor, to connect on an intimate level with my audience.  The actor and audience relationship is the most important part of the theatrical experience for me, as it invites potential for connection and understanding, both of oneself, and of the world we live in.

As an actor himself, writing for other actors, Shakespeare empowers the actor more than any other playwright, which is why I have devoted my career to studying and performing his work. He expects his actors to be in direct connection with the audience, and demands a huge imagination and well trained instrument, so they can tell truths, and affect change in the world. I have been changed by Shakespeare’s language. It has validated my own thoughts, feelings, and experiences, and has given me the idea that they are universal—that my personal experience is a part of the larger human experience. Shakespeare’s plays link me directly to humanity as a whole, and if more people can have an experience of discovering that their personal stories may be shared, as well, they will have a different relationship with the world, and it will begin to change.


What I Need & What You Get

My best estimates put my expenses at over $8,000 which would include a round-trip flight to London, 3 weeks accommodations, the program fee of 2,500 GBP (estimated at $4,750) and travel insurance. 

I am hoping to raise $3,000 towards covering those costs with your help.

What I am proposing is that, for your contribution, not only will you receive my eternal gratitude, the good karma usually reserved for those who return lost wallets (unpillaged,) but you will also receive poetry. Fresh, summer of 2015, (scares me to think that other people will be reading it,) original poetry authored by myself. $25 gets you a tasty haiku, $50 gets you a sassy limerick, and $100 gets you a sonnet (or perhaps the sonnet to end all sonnets.) I welcome and appreciate any amount of help so please don't feel that $25 is a minimum, or that you have to adhere to these denominations, (or that $200 is a maximum... winky face.) 

Help me help you (add to your poetry collection.)

Other Ways You Can Help

If money is tight, don't contribute. Please. I'll make it somehow. I'm not trying to put anybody out. But if you're so inclined you can share this campaign with anyone you think might want to or be able to help out. Or if you have any secrets to saving on travel or accommodations, get in touch with me as any help with saving money is the same as raising money. I am still looking for a place close-ish to the Globe (South Bank) to stay while I'm there.

story:
Short Summary


Standing before the Committee, a man claims to be the reincarnation of the notorious sixteenth century magician Cornelius Agrippa. In making his appeal, Agrippa brings them back in time, to tell of his other defense, the only time in history where an accused witch went before the Inquisition…and won.

Based on historical events…


Hello!

My name is Martin Sullivan and I'm here to ask for your help in getting this show off the ground! I am the writer and soon-to-be-performer of ‘The Reincarnation of Cornelius Agrippa’ under the Wilderland Theatre Collective! Im an actor/writer type who has performed around Ireland and in London. I'm DELIGHTED to be returning to theatre with a show I wrote, and one based on a true story! I have also recorded a full-length soundtrack instrumental album, a sample of one track can be heard in the trailer above! The trailer is basically both an introduction and to show there is a very strong and well-defined vision at work here.
This initial campaign is to help get everything up and running and to spread the word that this is coming to Ireland, the UK and beyond!

About Heinrich Cornelius Agrippa von Nettesheim

Heinrich Cornelius Agrippa von Nettesheim lived at the turn of the sixteenth century and among many other things, was a genuine polymath, an academic scholar who argued that the misogynistic ordering of society that places men over women was a social condition, and not a pre-ordained given. Through an academic lecture given at Dole, Agrippa used scripture to demonstrate this, attracting what turned into bitter opposition from the mendicant orders within the Church, in particular the Dominicans. The consequence of this was the portrayal of Agrippa as a ‘black magician’ who among other things was said to summon demons at will. This reputation would persist long after Agrippa’s death, even as a posthumous reference in Marlowe’s ‘Doctor Faustus’:

…Will be as cunning as Agrippa was

Whose shadow made all Europe honor him. (1.1.104-111)

The reality was that Agrippa studied and wrote about what was then called ‘natural magic’. Today this would amount to knowledge of aromatherapy, herbal supplements and essential oils. At different times he was an attendant to the Holy Roman Emperor Maximilian The First, acted as agent for the same in Paris, and would through military service come to be knighted. It was as  a public advocate within Metz that he would find himself defending an old peasant woman against the Inquisition…



What We Need & What You Get

This first call is to help pay for:
Costumes
Custom-built Props
Photography
Publicity/Advertising/Posters
Full Website Hosting
The perks scheme is also being used to get an audience together (Money is nice but without an audience I might as well be doing this in the mirror!). I also want to make is a bit special for those who show the faith and get on board earliest. 

So what will you get this first time around?
For EACH 5 Euro you donate, you will get

1 Ticket per 5 euro ( limited to 220 available tickets over all venues for the run of the Tour) 


1 album download (I download per ticket) 


1 E-programme.


To claim your ticket(s):

Each donor will be emailed a randomly generated code. This can then be used through the box office at any venue on the Tour in order to book your ticket in advance. Each show on the 2017 to 2019 tour will have a limited number of seats set aside for donors. These MUST be booked through the venue office. Donor seats will be issued on a 'First Come First Served Basis' and your performance of choice is NOT guaranteed. Tickets MUST be pre-booked before or by 3pm on the day of the performance. 

To claim your album(s):
Again, you will be issued a randomly generated code. The album is recorded and being produced as of the time of writing. The means of distribution is TBC. I want to check for sure what will be the best way to distribute in terms of file size/compression/music quality etc. Ill give more details when that's decided, as well as the track-listing (as of now 12 tracks).

Risks & Challenges


One of the reasons why I went with a three year tour was that there would be plenty of time to fulfill my obligations to you, the people who are going to help get this show on the road! This has been a very long time in the planning, and went up a gear from January this year. 
The major obstacle is start-up costs, in terms of props, costumes and venue bookings.  What this initial drive will let me do is present the full vision of what this show will be like i.e. in terms of of costumes and photography. The final script has been done for some time, the production choices have been made and  the feedback from editors has been great, as has initial responses to the album tracks. One venue in Dublin has been chosen and is being booked at the time of writing. I will be keeping everyone informed throughout the development process as the show takes shape during rehearsals and production so you know your money isnt being wasted.
I also know its a bit of an ask to put money into something at this early stage with just a video to show so the rewards do reflect that. Later on the price for tickets WILL be going up much higher so if you get in early, you stand to save a great deal!


Thanks for reading!

Martin

The major obstacle is start-up costs, in terms of props, costumes and venue bookings.  What this initial drive will let me do is present the full vision of what this show will be like i.e. in terms of of costumes and photography. The final script has been done for some time, the production choices have been made and  the feedback from editors has been great, as has initial responses to the album tracks. One venue in Dublin has been chosen and is being booked at the time of writing. I will be keeping everyone informed throughout the development process as the show takes shape during rehearsals and production so you know your money isnt being wasted.

I also know its a bit of an ask to put money into something at this early stage with just a video to show so the rewards do reflect that. Later on the price for tickets WILL be going up much higher so if you get in early, you stand to save a great deal!


Thanks for reading!

story:
Tombstone: A Cardboard Western is the newest and latest creation from Ramshackle Theatre. 
 
The show is an original cardboard science fiction show that will premiere at the Yukon Arts Centre in March 2017. 
 
We want to pay our hard working creators and artists. The money from this campaign will go to the people who are passionate about this project and have been working to make it happen for nearly three years. We love what we do and we need your help to make the final push to put the show first on a Yukon stage, then bring it to stages across the country. 
 

Why we need your help

Support artists!

Our team has been working hard building puppets and sets, including an army of cardboard robots.  They have already put in dozens of hours for free but we want to pay them properly for the work that remains. Your support of this show will help support hard-working artists for the basic costs of travel, accommodation and artists fees.

We will also be using the proceeds of this campaign to secure a rehearsal space for the dedicated cast to bring the script alive. With $10,000, five Ramshackle artists will spend approximately one month working together to build Tombstone into a stage-ready production.

At Ramshackle Theatre we're used to working on a shoestring. In fact, we would happily take that shoestring and use it in our show. We believe our artists should be compensated and valued for their work.

 

 

Tombstone: About the show

Tombstone is a live action puppet show that mashes the genres of science fiction and westerns and blends the worlds of puppetry and film. While the performers scramble to keep up with the onstage action the science fiction western B movie they are creating seamlessly unfolds on the screen above their heads. Watch a trailer for our last production, created in the same style. 

All of the puppets and set are constructed from cardboard, hot glue, magnets and things normal people might throw in the trash. But the simplicity of the materials is contrasted by the complexity of emotions explored through the main character Petal's identity crisis.

 

Ramshackle Theatre: Who we are

In our tiny studio in the Yukon’s boreal forest Ramshackle Theatre creates cardboard puppet shows,outdoor theatre events and original plays for Yukon and national audiences.

 

We keep things simple and count as our most trusted materials: hot glue, cardboard and magnets. No matter what the content of the production our starting place is: How do we create this work physically with what we have at hand? If we can’t build it from found materials, buy it cheap or borrow it, we tell the story simply.

story:
Short Summary

  • Hi, I'm Rachel Kunstadt. I am a NYC based musical theatre writer, playwright, and theatre producer. I hold a BA from NYU-Gallatin in Musical Theatre & The American Dream. I hold an MFA from NYU-Tisch's Graduate Musical Theatre Writing Program. I am also a 2nd year lyricist in the BMI Lehman Engel Musical Theatre Workshop, and I am a co-founder and the artistic director of LezCab, a non-profit theatre company for queer women.
  • Life Day is my story. I am very private, and often post cryptic Facebook statuses, about my mental illness/mental health journey. On January 9th, I will open up the closets, windows, and doors, and share my story.
  • All my life, I've been told to keep my personal life private, and not to air my dirty laundry. It's time to "trust my instincts, close my eyes, and leap" (Stephen Schwartz, Wicked).

Life Day will feature existing songs, both musical theatre and pop, contemporary and classic.

The Costs

Break it down, now baby:

  • The majority will go to paying the artists: director, music director, performer. I have assembled a group of phenomenal women to bring the story to life. 
  • Additional funds will go to music (purchasing sheet music & getting arrangements), marketing, rehearsal space, and printing/supplies.
  • The venue has been booked, so there's no going back now. I will cover funds not raised, but times is hard, sir, times is hard.

The Impact

I want to help others through art. I plan on reaching out to mental health organizations and getting them involved/inviting them to the show. If funds allow, I'd love to video the concert and perhaps even live stream it to those unable to make it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Strapped for cash? Here's how you can help!

  • Please consider sharing the campaign and the event on social media.
  • Please buy a ticket to Life Day. Tickets will be available very soon at www.theduplex.com

LIFE DAY: A MUSICAL MEMOIR
Monday, January 9th, 2017
7 pm
The Duplex
NYC

story:
Who are we?

Classics on the Rocks is a classical theatre company based in NYC. Our mission is to get the truth of classical works by telling the stories simply. 

We launched successfully in 2013 with a dream – to get rid of the stuffy stigma that so often surrounds classical theatre, instead, making it fun and accessible. We present simple clean shows and host rocking post show receptions where the audience can mingle with cast, talk about the Shakespeare, and have a blast. We’ve found a receptive audience here in NYC. In our first two years, we produced two staged readings, two one-night revues, our first summer mainstage production As You Like It, and launched our educational workshop series Working Classics.


What's in a name?

Classics on the Rocks was born from two loves – a love for Shakespeare and a love for whiskey.

What makes a whiskey good? When served with little more than “rocks” the depth of its flavors are allowed to stand out in their own “simple complexity.”

Embracing this concept of “simple complexity,” Classics on the Rocks eliminates fluff (fancy costumes), filler (big sets), and exotic concepts, instead, focusing on telling the story plainly and giving the characters room to breathe. We like our classics served “on the rocks.”


Why you're needed...

Being an independent theatre company in New York, offers all sorts of challenges ranging from finding ways to stand out and attract an audience to finding a performance space that offers the proper atmosphere. And naturally, all this comes with a price - even the most modest of performance and rehearsal spaces cost over $3,000.

This is why we need your support. We produce our shows as simply and efficiently as possible which is why we are raising only $3,000 which will cover our costs.

All donations will go directly towards our 2015 season consisting of Merchant of Venice running July 17-19 and our Working Classics educational workshop this fall in which will explore Henry V.

Your generous donation will help us:

  • print scripts & programs
  • rent rehearsal & performance space
  • acquire needed costume pieces
  • create necessary prop pieces

What do I get?

In addition to the personal satisfaction of supporting small theatre in NYC ;)  When you donate there are delightful perks for our donors ranging from:

  • Complimentary tickets to Merchant of Venice
  • "You Rock!" Classics on the Rocks pint glasses
  • A box of boozy mini-cupcakes (as seen at our spring birthday celebration for Shakespeare)
  • Private coaching sessions with our artistic and associate directors
  • A full scholarship to our Working Classics educational workshop
Note: Our classes and coaching sessions are the perfect thing for those looking to expand their horizons with classical works - whether for personal or professional gain. No prior experience with Shakespeare required. Just a love for words and desire to play.


Your Impact

In the words of Harold Clurman, "For life though it be individual to the end cannot be lived except in terms of people. Together, sure and strong in their togetherness."  We strive to create that togetherness.

At Classics, we create a home for actors young and old where they can gather together and share in their love of theatre, build a supportive community, and embrace the beautiful classical characters and stories that have withstood the test of time. Your donation will help us cultivate that home, grow our community, and expand our educational outreach to create an even bigger impact on the theatrical community at large.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, we totally get that.  If you love what we're up to but just don't have $15 to spare - we ask if you could:

  • Spread the word! Share our campaign with your friends, colleagues, and friends!
  • Like us on Facebook and follow us on twitter to stay in the know for future productions and campaigns.
  • Come see Merchant of Venice this July and join us for Working Classics this Fall!

story:
English version will follow

En 2015, Sylvain Émard Danse fête ses 25 ans. Vingt-cinq années consacrées avec passion à la création, à la production et à la diffusion d’oeuvres saisissantes. La compagnie compte aujourd’hui plus de 30 œuvres, à la gestuelle fluide, énergique et sensuelle. Le chorégraphe Sylvain Émard explore le territoire de la nature humaine à travers la puissance du corps. Au fil des ans, il s’est taillé une place enviable sur la scène de la danse contemporaine tant nationale qu’internationale. Sensible au métissage des genres, Sylvain Émard navigue avec aisance dans diverses sphères artistiques, tel qu’en témoigne sa collaboration sur l’opéra 1984 de Lorin Maazel, mise en scène par Robert Lepage et présentée, notamment sur les célèbres planches du Covent Garden à Londres (2005) et de La Scala de Milan (2008).

Reconnu pour le raffinement et la précision de son vocabulaire, Sylvain Émard en surprend plus d’un en créant Le Grand Continental au Festival TransAmériques (FTA) 2009. Passant d’une distribution de 65 danseurs amateurs en 2009 à plus de 200 interprètes non professionnels en 2011, cette oeuvre hybride à la croisée de la danse en ligne et de la danse contemporaine a suscité l’adhésion générale pour trois années consécutives au FTA. Ce vent de fraîcheur souffle bien au-delà de la métropole. New York, Philadelphie, Portland (Oregon), Mexico, Ottawa, Boston, Vancouver et Ansan (Corée du Sud) ont été renversés par cette vague continentalienne. À ce jour, Le Grand Continental a fait bouger plus de 1000 danseurs amateurs à travers le monde et séduit au-delà de 80 000 spectateurs!

D'un Continental à l'autre

Porté par le succès de ses précédentes éditions, Sylvain Émard Danse prépare une quatrième soirée-bénéfice sous le sceau du Grand Continental, baptisé D’un Continental à l’autre. Ce spectacle-anniversaire mixera les différentes moutures du célèbre concept qui fait vibrer les continents des deux côtés du Pacifique, depuis 2009. Quarante personnalités provenant des mondes culturel et des affaires livreront une performance électrisante. Vingt minutes swingnantes!

Un solo participatif

En grande primeur montréalaise, Sylvain Émard ouvrira le bal en offrant un solo bien spécial. Un solo créé à partir de vos idées! Vous êtes donc invités à lui proposer des mouvements qui inspireront la création de ce solo. Une occasion unique de participer au processus de création et de voir danser le chorégraphe.

L’événement-bénéfice 25e anniversaire/D’un Continental à l’autre de Sylvain Émard Danse se tiendra à Circuit-Est centre chorégraphique, situé au 2022, rue Sherbrooke Est, le 2 novembre à 20 h. Un cocktail-dessert suivra la représentation.

Les fonds recueillis lors de cette campagne de financement permettront à la compagnie de poursuivre sa mission de création, de production et de diffusion tant sur les scènes nationales qu’internationales.

***

Sylvain Émard Danse is celebrating its 25th anniversary this year, 25 years of passionate commitment to creating new works, to producing and presenting extraordinary dance. The company now counts more than 30 pieces in its repertoire, works rich in fluid, energetic, sensual movement. The choreographer Sylvain Émard explores the territory of human nature through the power of the body. Over the years he has established a privileged position on the contemporary dance scene nationally and internationally. Eager to mingle genres, Sylvain Émard moves freely through diverse artistic spheres, as can be seen in his collaboration on the Lorin Maazel opera 1984, directed by Robert Lepage and namely presented on the celebrated stages of Covent Garden in London (2005) and La Scala in Milan (2008).

Renowned for the refinement and precision of his dance vocabulary, Sylvain Émard surprised many when he presented Le Grand Continental at the Festival TransAmériques (FTA) in 2009. Shifting from a cast of 65 amateur dancers in 2009 to more than 200 non-professional performers in 2011, this hybrid piece that combines line dancing with contemporary dance was enthusiastically received for three years in a row at the FTA. And that breath of fresh air blew far beyond Montreal, with performances in New York, Philadelphia, Portland (Oregon), Mexico City, Ottawa, Boston, Vancouver and Ansan (South Korea) all swept away by the Continental wave. To date, Le Grand Continental has featured over 1000 amateur dancers around the world and delighted more than 80,000 spectators!

From One Continental to Another

Driven by the success of the previous editions, Sylvain Émard Danse is preparing a fourth benefit evening under the Grand Continental banner entitled D’un Continental à l’autre. This anniversary presentation will blend the different versions of the now famous concept that since 2009 has thrilled audiences in continents on both sides of the Pacific. Forty personalities from the cultural and business communities will take part in an electrifying performance. Get ready for 20 hot swinging minutes!

A Shared Solo 

In a grand Montreal première, Sylvain Émard will get things underway by presenting a very special solo, a piece concocted from your suggestions! You are invited to propose movements that will inspire its creation. This is a unique opportunity to participate in the creative process and also to see the choreographer perform the solo.
The 25th anniversary event D’un Continental à l’autre organized by Sylvain Émard Danse will take place at the Circuit-Est centre chorégraphique, located at 2022 Sherbrooke St. East on November 2 at 8 p.m. A cocktails-and-dessert reception will follow the performance.

Perks

$15 - Video of the D'un Continental à l'autre Performance
Select a video link or a DVD of the benefit performance of D'un Continental à l'autre. 

$25 - Assistant Choreographer
Propose a 3-second suite of movements to Sylvain Émard. He will integrate your proposal into the solo that he will present during the benefit evening. Like all other collaborators, your name will be listed in the evening program. You will also be sent a link so that you can view the final result of the dance piece. Submit your video to communication@sylvainemard.com.

$50 - Apprentice Choreographer
Feeling inspired? Propose a 6-second suite of movements to Sylvain Émard. He will integrate your proposal into the solo that he will present during the benefit evening. Like all other collaborators, your name will be listed in the evening program. You will also be sent a link so that you can view the final result of the dance piece. Submit your video to communication@sylvainemard.com. 

$100 - Artistic Consultant
Is the dormant artist within you eager to express untapped dance ideas? Propose a 12-second suite of movements to Sylvain Émard. He will integrate your proposal into the solo that he will present during the benefit evening. Like all other collaborators, your name will be listed in the evening program. You will also be sent a link so that you can view the final result of the dance piece. Submit your video to communication@sylvainemard.com.

$150 - Ticket to Benefit Event
Attend the D’un Continental à l’autre event celebrating the company’s 25th anniversary on November 2 at 8 p.m. at the Circuit-Est centre chorégraphique. A cocktail reception will follow the performance.

$250 - Private Dance Workshop
Form a group and treat yourselves to a two-hour workshop with Sylvain Émard in the studios of the Circuit-Est centre chorégraphique. 

$1500 - Join the Cast
If you’ve always dreamed of dancing on a stage and being directed by professionals, now’s your chance! Join forces with forty business and cultural personalities in thirty hours of rehearsal before hitting the boards of the Circuit-Est centre chorégraphique for the D'un Continental à l'autre benefit performance. Become an ardent fan of the Grand Continental!

$2000 - Solo by Sylvain
Enjoy a very private performance! If you live within a 50 km radius of Montreal, Sylvain Émard will show up in your living room to present a private performance of the solo created for the benefit evening.

The monies raised during this fundraising campaign will allow the company to pursue its mission of creating, producing and presenting new dance on both the national and international stage.
story_txt:
English version will followEn 2015, Sylvain Émard
Danse fête ses 25 ans. Vingt-cinq années consacrées avec passion à la création,
à la production et à la diffusion d’oeuvres saisissantes. La compagnie compte
aujourd’hui plus de 30 œuvres, à la gestuelle fluide, énergique et sensuelle.
Le chorégraphe Sylvain Émard explore le territoire de la nature humaine à
travers la puissance du corps. Au fil des ans, il s’est taillé une place
enviable sur la scène de la danse contemporaine tant nationale
qu’internationale. Sensible au métissage des genres, Sylvain Émard navigue avec
aisance dans diverses sphères artistiques, tel qu’en témoigne sa collaboration
sur l’opéra 1984 de Lorin Maazel,
mise en scène par Robert Lepage et présentée, notamment sur les célèbres planches
du Covent Garden à Londres (2005) et de La Scala de Milan (2008).
Reconnu pour le
raffinement et la précision de son vocabulaire, Sylvain Émard en surprend plus
d’un en créant Le Grand Continental
au Festival TransAmériques (FTA) 2009. Passant d’une distribution de 65
danseurs amateurs en 2009 à plus de 200 interprètes non professionnels en 2011,
cette oeuvre hybride à la croisée de la danse en ligne et de la danse
contemporaine a suscité l’adhésion générale pour trois années consécutives au
FTA. Ce vent de fraîcheur souffle bien au-delà de la métropole. New York,
Philadelphie, Portland (Oregon), Mexico, Ottawa, Boston, Vancouver et Ansan (Corée du Sud) ont été
renversés par cette vague continentalienne. À ce jour, Le Grand Continental a fait bouger plus de 1000 danseurs amateurs à
travers le monde et séduit au-delà de 80 000 spectateurs!
D'un Continental à l'autre
Porté par le succès de
ses précédentes éditions, Sylvain Émard Danse prépare une quatrième
soirée-bénéfice sous le sceau du Grand
Continental, baptisé D’un
Continental à l’autre. Ce spectacle-anniversaire mixera les différentes
moutures du célèbre concept qui fait vibrer les continents des deux côtés du
Pacifique, depuis 2009. Quarante personnalités provenant des mondes culturel et
des affaires livreront une performance électrisante. Vingt minutes swingnantes!
Un solo participatif
En grande primeur
montréalaise, Sylvain Émard ouvrira le bal en offrant un solo bien spécial. Un
solo créé à partir de vos idées! Vous êtes donc invités à lui proposer des
mouvements qui inspireront la création de ce solo. Une occasion unique de
participer au processus de création et de voir danser le chorégraphe.

L’événement-bénéfice 25e anniversaire/D’un
Continental à l’autre de Sylvain Émard Danse se tiendra à Circuit-Est
centre chorégraphique, situé au 2022, rue Sherbrooke Est, le 2 novembre à 20 h. Un cocktail-dessert suivra
la représentation.

Les fonds recueillis lors de cette campagne de
financement permettront à la compagnie de poursuivre sa mission de création, de
production et de diffusion tant sur les scènes nationales qu’internationales. ***
Sylvain Émard Danse is celebrating its 25th anniversary this
year, 25 years of passionate commitment to creating new works, to producing and
presenting extraordinary dance. The company now counts more than 30 pieces in
its repertoire, works rich in fluid, energetic, sensual movement. The choreographer
Sylvain Émard explores the territory of human nature through the power of the
body. Over the years he has established a privileged position on the contemporary
dance scene nationally and internationally. Eager to mingle genres, Sylvain
Émard moves freely through diverse artistic spheres, as can be seen in his
collaboration on the Lorin Maazel opera 1984,
directed by Robert Lepage and namely presented on the celebrated stages of
Covent Garden in London (2005) and La Scala in Milan (2008).
Renowned for the refinement and precision of his dance vocabulary, Sylvain
Émard surprised many when he presented Le
Grand Continental at the Festival TransAmériques (FTA) in 2009. Shifting
from a cast of 65 amateur dancers in 2009 to more than 200 non-professional
performers in 2011, this hybrid piece that combines line dancing with contemporary
dance was enthusiastically received for three years in a row at the FTA. And that
breath of fresh air blew far beyond Montreal, with performances in New York,
Philadelphia, Portland (Oregon), Mexico City, Ottawa, Boston, Vancouver and Ansan
(South Korea) all swept away by the Continental wave. To date, Le Grand Continental has featured over
1000 amateur dancers around the world and delighted more than 80,000 spectators!
From One Continental to
Another
Driven by the success of the previous editions, Sylvain Émard Danse is preparing
a fourth benefit evening under the Grand
Continental banner entitled D’un
Continental à l’autre. This anniversary presentation will blend the different
versions of the now famous concept that since 2009 has thrilled audiences in
continents on both sides of the Pacific. Forty personalities from the cultural
and business communities will take part in an electrifying performance. Get
ready for 20 hot swinging minutes!
A Shared Solo  
In a grand Montreal première, Sylvain Émard will get things underway by presenting
a very special solo, a piece concocted from your suggestions! You are invited
to propose movements that will inspire its creation. This is a unique opportunity
to participate in the creative process and also to see the choreographer
perform the solo.

The 25th anniversary event D’un
Continental à l’autre organized by Sylvain Émard Danse will take place at
the Circuit-Est centre chorégraphique, located at 2022 Sherbrooke St. East on November 2 at 8 p.m. A cocktails-and-dessert
reception will follow the performance.


Perks


$15 - Video
of the D'un Continental à l'autre Performance
Select a video link or a DVD of the benefit
performance of D'un Continental à
l'autre. 
$25 - Assistant
Choreographer
Propose a 3-second suite of movements to Sylvain
Émard. He will integrate your proposal into the solo that he will present during
the benefit evening. Like all other collaborators, your name will be listed in
the evening program. You will also be sent a link so that you can view the
final result of the dance piece. Submit your video to
communication@sylvainemard.com.
$50 - Apprentice
Choreographer Feeling inspired? Propose a 6-second suite of movements
to Sylvain Émard. He will integrate your proposal into the solo that he will
present during the benefit evening. Like all other collaborators, your name
will be listed in the evening program. You will also be sent a link so that you
can view the final result of the dance piece. Submit your video to
communication@sylvainemard.com. 
$100 - Artistic
Consultant
Is the dormant artist within you eager to express
untapped dance ideas? Propose a 12-second suite of movements to Sylvain Émard. He
will integrate your proposal into the solo that he will present during the
benefit evening. Like all other collaborators, your name will be listed in the evening
program. You will also be sent a link so that you can view the final result of
the dance piece. Submit your video to communication@sylvainemard.com.
$150 - Ticket
to Benefit Event
Attend the D’un Continental à l’autre event celebrating
the company’s 25th anniversary on November 2 at 8 p.m. at the
Circuit-Est centre chorégraphique. A
cocktail reception will follow the performance.
$250 - Private
Dance Workshop Form a group and treat yourselves to a two-hour
workshop with Sylvain Émard in the studios of the Circuit-Est centre
chorégraphique. 
$1500 - Join
the Cast
If you’ve always dreamed of dancing on a stage and
being directed by professionals, now’s your chance! Join forces with forty
business and cultural personalities in thirty hours of rehearsal before hitting
the boards of the Circuit-Est centre chorégraphique for the D'un Continental à l'autre benefit
performance. Become an ardent fan of the Grand
Continental!
$2000 - Solo
by Sylvain
Enjoy a very private performance! If you live within a
50 km radius of Montreal, Sylvain Émard will show up in your living room to
present a private performance of the solo created for the benefit evening.The monies raised during this fundraising campaign will
allow the company to pursue its mission of creating, producing and presenting
new dance on both the national and international stage.

story:
Campaign Summary

TheatreMcLean is the high school theatre program at McLean High School. This award winning after school program is comprised of over 150 passionate students. Our mission is to create thoughtful works of art on story at a time. TheatreMclean has produced plays, musicals, and one acts that reach out to the community.

Our next show 9 to 5 is our most exciting show to date. The musical, based on the movie, is the perfect show to put on stage in this moment of history with its message of true female empowerment. We have the most students ever working on a musical, and with your help, we can make this musical one you’ll never forget.

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign is to help with our rigging system which will enable our actors to fly. A system like this is hard to come by, which is why many high schools forgo moments like these. We don’t want to be like most high schools, though. With your contribution we will be able to achieve theatre magic and let our students soar.

You'll receive some one-of-a-kind perks when you support us today--including photos with our leading ladies, a TheatreMcLean season subscription, and a backstage tour to see the rigging system in action!

$3,000 is an ambitious goal, but with the help of our biggest fans (like YOU), we hope we can reach this funding level in the next 28 days. If we do not reach the goal, all funds raised will still be applied to the cost of the rigging system and training for student technicians and actors.

***TheatreMcLean Boosters are a 501(c)3 nonprofit. All donations are tax deductible to the extent allowed by law.***

The Impact

A rigging system is a very big deal for a high school theatre program. There are only a few companies in the United States that work with high schools, and Flying by Foy is one of the best in the business. With your contribution, TheatreMclean’s production of 9 to 5 will be taken to the next level. Never before in Mclean High School’s history has someone flown through the air. With your contribution you can be a part of something brand new. We are proud to put on award winning work, and this fly system would greatly help our production. The impact this fly system will have on the show is tremendous, during intermission, that’s what we want the audience to be talking about. Help us make that happen!

Risks & Challenges

Making someone fly is not an easy task. There are numerous safety hurdles and finding the right fly company is often difficult. This is why many schools don’t fly their actors because they are afraid something might go wrong, or they don’t have the funds to get the best system possible.

TheatreMclean, however, isn’t afraid of the risks. We often choose the risky path because our students are hungry to be better performers. We wouldn’t have decided to fly someone if we thought our student’s weren’t ready. They are responsible enough to take on the challenge. We studied and researched the best fly company, and thanks to our many successful shows we are close to being able to purchase them. That’s where you come in. Something this gargantuan isn’t cheap, and while we are a successful after school program, it isn’t enough. For something this important, TheatreMcLean needs the best in safety and product. Flying by Foy is that company. With your contribution we will be able to secure them and succeed in our endeavor.

Other Ways You Can Help

You might not be able to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word on social media about our campaign!
  • Buy a ticket to attend a performance of "9 to 5: The Musical"!

For more information on the show and our program, please visit www.theatremclean.org. 

Have questions about this campaign? Please email Katy Beth Cassell at katybethcassell@gmail.com.

story:
*This year, we have chosen three classics as part of our regular season - The Pajama Game and She Loves Me, two musical theatre standards, and the comedy gem Harvey  - that are sure to delight and entertain audiences of all generations.

*We are also excited to host another youth theatre summer camp with our production of Aladdin Jr.  This multi-week camp in June will give kids the opportunity to learn the basics of acting, musical theatre, choreography, and technical design.  The camp will culminate in an abridged production of Disney's classic animated feature.

*In order to produce our 2018 season, we need to raise $5,000 to cover a variety of costs, including show rights, venue space, design and construction materials, audiovisual equipment, and other potential expenses. 

*If you visit the "Perks" section of this fundraising page, you will see the different benefits associated with each level of contribution.

story:
It's a rebellion performance event produced by BONEdanse about the human herding mentality found in all of us. We relate to you, challenge you to think, and invite you to feel. bully.punk.riot asks are you friend or foe?

bully.punk.riot premieres
June 20-30, 2013
Th/Fr/Sat/Su @ 7p
Links Hall, 3111 N. Western Ave, Chicago
venue: linkshall.org
tickets: ticketfly.com
bonedanse.com


Our goal of $3,500 is only a small portion of the total cost of this production. We can't do any of this without your collective support. When you say "Yes" to supporting us you are validating our existance and giving us that pat on the back that only you can provide.

The Artists

 


You deserve quality performance that moves you emotionally - makes you want to get out of that chair and dance, fight, scream, cheer or even convulse! The allure of BONEdanse is that our story is one of people, just like you, telling stories, building works from the core, and finding a physical and emotional force that only dance theater can encompass. We break the rules of convention and create art that you can feel viscerally.

 

  • Venue Rental ($3000)
  • Performer Fees (7 x $550 = $3850)
  • Lighting Designer ($1200)
  • Stage Manager - ($500)
  • Costumes & Props ($800)
  • Liability Insurance ($900 annually)
  • 2 night Videography Documentation ($500)
  • 2 hour Photo Session ($250)
  • Marketing/Advertising ($1000)

 


Some of our best friends can't donate. We get that - we really do. As artists we live by that monthly paycheck as well. BUT you can help in many ways:

  • Share our project on social media!
  • Word of Mouth still is the BEST!
  • Volunteer for our event! Usher, assemble programs, crew backstage, or help us build some theater flats in June! Contact BONEdanseur Melissa Ganser: melissa.ganser@gmail.com

 

   

Thank you for your continued support over the 16 years we've been around. It means the world to us! BONEdanse/Breakbone DanceCo. is an Illinois Not-for-Profit Organization 501(c)3 since 1997. Your donations are tax-ductible and greatly appreciated!

story:
****During this campaign we were accepted to The NYFRINGE Festival! ***ANY ADDITIONAL FUNDS BEYOND OUR WORKSHOP GOAL WILL GO DIRECTLY TO HELP FUND OUR REGISTRATION FEE ($650) and INSURANCE ($200) FOR THE NYFRINGE 2013 WORLD PREMIERE in August.***

WHO WE ARE

HI! We're Greencard Wedding, a theatrical two person indie folk-beatbox-rock band. We're both actors and musicians who write music and plays. We met in a church on a rainy night, in Crown Heights Brooklyn, and the rest is history in the making. We moved in together for almost two years, in order to make theater and music 24/7. . . till Michael's visa ran out and he had to move back to Amsterdam. 

But we are not easily discouraged. Like starcrossed creative soul mates, we decided we had to find a way to beat the international distance and keep working and touring together. So we wrote a Skype show (based on transcriptions of our calls) with music, video and a guest appearance by one of our favorite actors: David Anzuelo. The show relys heavily on live Skyping onstage so it will be possible to perform even we are apart. But right now, this is the one time we really need to be together in the same place during this process. We've been offered a chance to reunite in order to have an intensive workshop with a director, producer and video designer and present the work in progress in New York this May. After the workshop, the show will be polished, tech'd, ready to be presented in the NY Fringe Festival 2013.

We just need a teeny tiny bit of help to finish funding the workshop.

 

WHAT WE NEED

Just a tiny bit! This is a super bare bones multi-media show. We've always found ways to make a lot of the techincal requirements ourselves and it all has a very indie bohemian DITY feel. The film footage was shot by our audience. The videos were edited by Jody. The website was built by Jody and translated by Michael. The props are all things that have been made by us for our shows- we even bake our own Frisian wedding cake!

The only things we can't make are aeroplanes (that cross the ocean) and money to pay our team (though we have squirrled away half of it from our previous DC tour and gigs! Thanks NASA and Dixon Place, Parkside Lounge and more!) 

 Check out more details and photos of our gigs at www.greencardwedding.com- it speaks Dutch and English!

 

Here's what your donations will do to help us meet our small goal:

  • Secure  a plane ticket- we've got a sweet deal going on with an airline but we do need $300 to finish covering the costs of bringing Michael to America to workshop the play for a week in May.
  • Afford modest stipends for our creative team: director Pirronne Yousefzadeh, producer Aaron Simms, video designer TBA, an additional actor (David Anzuelo!), to be able to focus their time and attention on the project for the intense week.
  • Secure Rehearsal Space: we need space that allows us to Skype (that means two rooms) as well as project Skype and video.

 

Any money raised beyond our goal will go towards funding future productions of THE SKYPE SHOW! (Which really costs next to nothing to present and mount!)

 

WHY YOU ARE AWESOME AND WHAT YOU GET FOR BEING AWESOME

Well, you've read this far already so that means you've given our story your time and we appreciate it greatly. By helping us get through this stage of the project you will have helped us to take a giant leap towards a sustainable way of working together long term as well as devloping a new innovative use for Skype in performance. We also hope that this show may help to begin making a case for Michael's artist Visa.

 

When you donate we want to give you great stuff. Here's what we came up with:

$1-$24 a thank you in the program and free download of a professional recording of our most popular song (which is featured in the show) "Stargazer's Lullaby": http://www.reverbnation.com/greencardweddingband/song/14473771-stargazers-lullaby

 

$25-$49 below mentioned perks, plus a professional recording of a new song written for the show "See You in April" before it is released, and a handmade recipie card for Greencard Wedding's Oranjekoek (Frisian Wedding Cake) .

 

$50-99 Below mentioned perks, plus a ticket to sit in on the closed workshop.
 
 
$100- $249  Below mentioned perks, plus photo session with Jody Christopherson for up to 3 hours. Can be used for head shots (as many looks as you want in 3 hours), portraits, photocalls, to document rehearsals, promo shots and more. Shot on a Canon 5D Mark ll. Please contact Jody first before purchasing to coordinate schedules!  Here's some examples of her work: http://www.flickr.com/photos/58725443@N04/sets/72157633350368117/
 
 
$250 Below mentioned perks, plus a private 45 minute Greencard Wedding concert in May- we will come to your house or party and play and bake you Fresian Wedding Cake. Please contact us before selecting this perk to coordinate scheduling.
 

$500- all the below mentioned perks plus a producer credit on the developmental workshop

But we are not easily discouraged. Like starcrossed creative soul mates, we decided we had to find a way to beat the international distance and keep working and touring together. So we wrote a Skype show (based on transcriptions of our calls) with music, video and a guest appearance by one of our favorite actors: David Anzuelo. The show relys heavily on live Skyping onstage so it will be possible to perform even we are apart. But right now, this is the one time we really need to be together in the same place during this process. We've been offered a chance to reunite in order to have an intensive workshop with a director, producer and video designer and present the work in progress in New York this May. After the workshop, the show will be polished, tech'd, ready to be presented in the NY Fringe Festival 2013.
We just need a teeny tiny bit of help to finish funding the workshop.
 
WHAT WE NEED
Just a tiny bit! This is a super bare bones multi-media show. We've always found ways to make a lot of the techincal requirements ourselves and it all has a very indie bohemian DITY feel. The film footage was shot by our audience. The videos were edited by Jody. The website was built by Jody and translated by Michael. The props are all things that have been made by us for our shows- we even bake our own Frisian wedding cake!
The only things we can't make are aeroplanes (that cross the ocean) and money to pay our team (though we have squirrled away half of it from our previous DC tour and gigs! Thanks NASA and Dixon Place, Parkside Lounge and more!) 
 Check out more details and photos of our gigs at www.greencardwedding.com- it speaks Dutch and English!
 
Here's what your donations will do to help us meet our small goal:

Secure  a plane ticket- we've got a sweet deal going on with an airline but we do need $300 to finish covering the costs of bringing Michael to America to workshop the play for a week in May.
Afford modest stipends for our creative team: director Pirronne Yousefzadeh, producer Aaron Simms, video designer TBA, an additional actor (David Anzuelo!), to be able to focus their time and attention on the project for the intense week.
Secure Rehearsal Space: we need space that allows us to Skype (that means two rooms) as well as project Skype and video.

 
Any money raised beyond our goal will go towards funding future productions of THE SKYPE SHOW! (Which really costs next to nothing to present and mount!)
 
WHY YOU ARE AWESOME AND WHAT YOU GET FOR BEING AWESOME
Well, you've read this far already so that means you've given our story your time and we appreciate it greatly. By helping us get through this stage of the project you will have helped us to take a giant leap towards a sustainable way of working together long term as well as devloping a new innovative use for Skype in performance. We also hope that this show may help to begin making a case for Michael's artist Visa.
 
When you donate we want to give you great stuff. Here's what we came up with:
$1-$24 a thank you in the program and free download of a professional recording of our most popular song (which is featured in the show) "Stargazer's Lullaby": http://www.reverbnation.com/greencardweddingband/song/14473771-stargazers-lullaby
 
$25-$49 below mentioned perks, plus a professional recording of a new song written for the show "See You in April" before it is released, and a handmade recipie card for Greencard Wedding's Oranjekoek (Frisian Wedding Cake) .
 

$50-99 Below mentioned perks, plus a ticket to sit in on the closed workshop.

 
 

$100- $249  Below mentioned perks, plus photo session with Jody Christopherson for up to 3 hours. Can be used for head shots (as many looks as you want in 3 hours), portraits, photocalls, to document rehearsals, promo shots and more. Shot on a Canon 5D Mark ll. Please contact Jody first before purchasing to coordinate schedules!  Here's some examples of her work: http://www.flickr.com/photos/58725443@N04/sets/72157633350368117/

 
 

$250 Below mentioned perks, plus a private 45 minute Greencard Wedding concert in May- we will come to your house or party and play and bake you Fresian Wedding Cake. Please contact us before selecting this perk to coordinate scheduling.

 
$500- all the below mentioned perks plus a producer credit on the developmental workshop

story:
Le théâtre de la Vache Folle est une compagnie créée par six comédiens et comédiennes , irrésistiblement atteints d'une douce folie contagieuse. 

Ensemble, ils créent "Les Soirées De La Vache Folle", spectacles de lectures publiques à caractère strictement humoristique et absurde.

Le but de notre compagnie est d'apporter un peu de soleil dans la vie des gens, alors que la vie semble bien souvent morne et même dramatique... Nous ne présentons AUCUN spectacle qui ne soit pas humoristique. 

Les fonds amassés servirons à nous produire dans le plus d'endroits possible afin d'atteindre un plus large publique et de propager notre rigolade. Il n'y a pas de prix d'entrée pour nos spectacles, seulement des contributions volontaires. Les gens qui ont besoin de rire n'ont souvent pas les moyens de se payer une soirée qui leur permettra de le faire... 

En faisant un don, vous contribuerez donc à mettre un sourire dans le visage de quelqu'un qui en a besoin :)

Pour se faire, nous avons besoin d'argent pour nous déplacer, pour la location de lieux de diffusion et pour tout frais qui s'y rattache. 

Les comédiens et comédiennnes du Théâtres de la Vache Folle, tous professionnels, le font bénévolement.

Visitez notre site Internet ! http://theatredelavachefoll.wix.com/lavachefolle

Au nom de tous, MERCI !

Martin Sénéchal, Théâtre de La Vache Folle

story:
Exotic Flavors of Bradley Copperfield

A grandfather recounts his days as a care-free bachelor, reminiscing about his exotic experiences with his eccentric exes in an effort to dissuade young Jake from breaking up with his girlfriend. Bradley Copperfield made the same rash choices, ending his relationships with his enticing exes due to flavorful “fatal flaws.” But one nitpicked flavor bites back with a reality check aftertaste. A sugary sweet romantic comedy that explores the intangibles of relationships and encourages lovebirds to highlight the positives in their partners. Because let’s face it: nobody’s perfect.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Putting together a show can become costly.  The money that you would contribute would be going towards the following:

1) Renting the actual theatre space

2) Sets, props & costumes

3) Advertising, including; signs, mailings, websites

4) The actors

5) We also need to pay for those EXOTIC perks on the right hand side of this screen! :)

The Impact

Every little bit of your donation will help in some way; sets, props, costumes, advertising, the cast, etc.  Every dollar will go toward something and there's no way we would be able to do this show if it weren't for your help.

 

Meet the cast and crew

 

 

Jon Christie - Writer/Director/Producer

Jon has written, produced, and directed six of his own original works in Dallas TX. His first, Dream, received an encore performance at Collin College (the only student work to receive such an honor.) Another, The Zookeeper's Journal, received publication in 2012 by Next Stage Press. Still another, One Phone Call, participated in the 2011 FIT Festival. Jon has also had the pleasure of directing other author's work, including Neil Simon's Rumors. The Exotic Flavors of Bradley Copperfield will be the first of his original plays to receive production in the Los Angeles area.

Cherami Leigh - Assistant Director

Cherami Leigh has been in the industry for almost 20 years. She has been in over 75 commercials, and has worked on over 100 anime projects. She has appeared in the Emmy Award Winning "Temple Grandin", as well as "Friday Night Lights," "The Deep End," "Chase," "New Girl," and "Walker Texas Ranger" to name a few. She worked on "Fast Food Nation," with Richard Linklater, "The Hottest State," with Ethan Hawke, "The Mist," with Frank Darabont among others. She stars in the soon to be released "Beyond the Farthest Star," the animated film "Ribbit," alongside Tim Curry, and Sean Astin, and in the indie "CRY," currently making rounds on the film festival circuit. Leigh has projects in various stages of development that she is looking forward to. In addition to performing in over 17 shows, she has worked with Jon Christie on 7 shows in Dallas, both on stage and behind the scenes and is excited to be making this jump to see "Exotic" entertain and enlighten audiences.

 

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0473873/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1

 

J.D. Driskill as Bradley Copperfield and Co-Producer

Aside from being the co-producer and playing Bradley, J.D. has been seen on stages all over California.  A 2009 graduate of AMDA, his recent roles include Roger in Rent (2 LA Stage Scene Awards), Amnon in the premier rock musical David, Demetrius in A Midsummer Nights Dream, Prince in Cinderella, Joseph in Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat , Chuck in Footloose (AriZoni Award) and will be playing Warner in Legally Blonde at Cabrillo musical theatre this summer. J.D. has recently released his debut acoustic album "Fairytale...That Once Upon A Time Thing" available on ITunes now. Follow him at twitter.com/jddriskill or check him out at www.jddriskill.com! Aside from theatre, J.D. recently shot the pilot Bathroom Diaries, starred in a PSA for PBS, has a Web Series entitled "Dudes...Baby" for which he Directs, co-writes and stars in and can be viewed on Youtube. His latest project is a full length independent film called "Alex Grant" which he wrote as well and has plans of shooting in the Spring of 2013.  J.D. also recently signed on with Empire films to co-write, with his business partner from Clear Absent Productions, a new horror film entitled How To Destroy Angels; currently in pre-production. 

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5250435/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1

 

Timothy Guest as Grandpa

This Texas native trained at Louisiana State University, received an Air Force commission, and spent the next several years performing theatre wherever he was stationed in the U.S. and Europe.  Guest has appeared in Los Angeles area theatre productions as Andrey Botvinik in "A Walk In The Woods," Antonio Salieri in "Amadeus," Chris Keller in "All My Sons," and in more than  50 other LA and regional theatre productions.  Recent film roles include the alternative reality of “Allegiance,” the dark comedy “Midlife” with Arye Gross and Nicolas Coster, and the family drama "Sanctuary" with Trevor Morgan and Catherine Dent.  Television credits include the recurring role of Don Overman on "The Young and the Restless," five episodes of “Cost Of Capital,” and five episodes of the original "Mighty Morphin' Power Rangers." He also stars in the ground breaking short film “Apple of My Eye” that went viral on the Internet garnering over half a million hits during its first three days. He is represented by Amanda Chacon at Aspire Talent.

 

Morris Schorr as Grandpa

After a quarter century managing law firms, Morry Schorr returned to acting in 2005.  Since then he has appeared on stage, most recently at SkyPilot Theater in KONG, A GODDAM 30 FOOT GORILLA, on the internet, most recently in the web series GOT DRIVE, in film, most recently in the comedy THE TEST and on TV, notably in NIP/TUCK and, most recently, the new series FRIEND ME.  Morry received degrees in Theater Arts from SUNY Binghamton and the University of  Illinois and an MBA from Cal State Northridge.

 

 Derek Stusynski as Jake

Derek Stusynski was raised on a farm in Karlstad, MN. He studied acting at The New York Conservatory for Dramatic Arts before moving to Los Angeles last year. Recent credits include Blood Relatives, Eden, and award-winning shorts I Am Julia and Path to Prologue. Derek also loves writing and is currently working on a book trilogy titledCyropathia and a new web series called The Walking Tedd.

 

Nicole Starrett as Kate

 After 5 years of working, training, and playing in New York City, Nicole Starrett moved to L.A. based
entirely on a gut feeling that it was the right thing for her to do. It's been working out great so far!  A graduate of Circle in the Square and the UVM, Nicole has lived in Mexico City, is certified to teach Spanish. Nicole has appeared in films, national television, off-Broadway, and has been known to play sax on the streets of New York.  For more information, please visit www.nikkistarrett.com .

Kali Cook as Strawberry

Kali's independent spirit and passion for performing drove her from her small town upbringing outside of Pittsburgh to pursue her career in Los Angeles. She recently worked on the feature film "A Place Called Hollywood" and is co-writing her first full length script. Other credits include, Cold Case, Lovely, Still and the short film 40 Hours, which she also wrote and which screened in Best of Fest at the LA Comedy Fest. "Acting makes me feel free and writing allows me to create worlds. there's nothing better than that" 

Samantha Valdellon as Blueberry

 is an actress and violinist born and raised in New York.  LA theatre credits include: "Doctor, Doctor!", "Fluffy Bunnies In A Field of Daisies", “The Brahmin & The Tiger” and "Mother Tongue". Sammy can also be seen rockin the fiddle in the bluesy rock band Blackcoat Duo, or alongside singer-songwriter Sarah Ault, playing intimate venues throughout Los Angeles.  www.samanthavaldellon.com 

Tanya Katchouni as Watermelon

Tanya started out as a dancer, performing and competing Internationally for over five years. When she decided dancing wasn't the career path she wanted, she took an Intro to Acting class, on a whim, and got hooked. Since then, she has appeared in numerous Canadian television shows including YTV and Discovery Kids' Prank Patrol, HBO Canada's Living in Your Car, and the upcoming Walter's World. She has also had the privilege of working on some amazing Award-Winning Independent films, and played Gabriella Montez in the Canadian Stage Premiere of High School Musical 2 in Toronto. Last year she appeared in two Canadian National Commercials and had the opportunity to work with Award-Winning director Laura Turek in the upcoming Web Series Where's Leroy which also stars hilarious comedian, Mike Paterson

Cody Bushee as Zane

Cody has been involved in many short/feature films all throughout his college and post college career. Some of Cody's favorite theatre roles include, Iago (Othello), CB (Dog Sees God: Confessions of a Teenage Blockhead), Cat in the Hat (Suessical the Musical), Vince Fontaine (Grease) and Simon the Zealot (The Last Days of Judas Iscariot).

Julita Penido as Kate/Watermelon Understudy 

A recent graduate from Mount Holyoke College with a BA in Astronomy and French. She studied at the Eugene O’Neill National Theater Institute with incredible artists such as Jeff Janisheski, Davis McCallum, David Chandler, Duane Boutte, Peg Denithorne, Elizabeth Rothan, Brian McManamon, and Colman Domingo. She also studied with members from the Complicite and Propeller companies in London.

Colleen Boag as Strawberry/Blueberry Understudy

Colleen Irene Boag is an award winning actress who has been fascinated by people since before she could walk. She loves throwing herself fearlessly into each and every role she's handed.  Each week she has the pleasure of diving into new material at Carter/Thor Studios where she continues to grow her skills .

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3046890/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1

story:
Thanks for checking out our PortFringe campaign!

Here's the low-down:


What is PortFringe?

PortFringe is a week-long “fringe” theater festival in Portland’s downtown arts district that supports theater and performance artists, encourages artistic innovation, and provides an accessible, affordable outlet for exciting work that enriches Maine's creative community.

We love originality and collaboration, coupled with weird and DIY-style performance, that makes PortFringe like no other experience around. We hope you are inspired by our rambunctious raccoon mascot, Flome (and pal KittyShark) to contribute to this incredible experience that is fast becoming a Portland institution!

Now in its second year, PortFringe is an open-access, non-juried theater festival in which participants are chosen by a random lottery. There are no production fees for participants and 100% of ticket sales are returned to the performance artist or company.

The 2013 festival line-up, announced last month at Geno's Rock Club, includes over 50 productions representing over 350 individual performers, designers, playwrights, and other theater artists from Maine and beyond.

This second annual PortFringe will take place at 4 downtown performance venues (SPACE Gallery, Geno's, Portland Stage Company's studio theater, and the Portland Stage storefront) from June 26-30, 2013. Five days jam packed with comedy, tragedy, and lots of oddity.

If I donate money, what will it pay for?

Your generous contribution will help pay for venue rentals, box office and ticketing costs, programs, insurance, marketing materials, and super-fun, celebratory events. PortFringe is an entirely volunteer labor of love, but we need your help to succeed. Again, we ask our community for these funds so that all profits from ticket sales can go straight back to PortFringe artists.

This festival sounds awesome! How can I learn more?

See our full schedule and get more information at portfringe.com. We hope to see you in the audience this June!

story:
Short Summary 

This year SUDS (The University of Sussex Drama Society) will be sending the original play "Toys" to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival. The clever clogs who have made this play are Jack BK, Gabriel Owen and Lucy Gray, all of whom have written, directed, produced, starred in and marketed their own plays before this. So we are quite the budding thespians (i.e. people who won’t cock it up). 

 The play goes as such: Miles and Katie wake up tied to chairs in the sound proof drum room of their comfy Kensington House. They think they are subject to an aggressive robbery until Darren, the typical 'benefits-street' lad, calmly walks down into the room and throws an accusation at Miles which, if true, will rip his life apart. Toys is a play that questions Britain's endless obsession with class. Its raw, stripped back energy and deconstruction of the everyday topics we face will force you to question issues of privilege, struggle and position in society. 

 What We Need & What You Get

 Being students this is obviously something we are unable to completely fund on our own. We are doing our utmost to fundraise for costs such as travel, venue hire and registration fees (all of which leave big holes in our pockets already), but accommodation is our main burden. We have a total cast and crew of 6 people and Edinburgh is notoriously expensive at that time of year. After doing lots of research we managed to find a place for a total of £1000 for the whole stay which is fantastic but still more then we can afford on top of everything else. We realise that asking for money so we can stay somewhere is a bit less thrilling then perhaps going towards massive set designs or SFX, but the truth is, this is the only thing holding us back. We have already paid so much from our own stash and are planning numerous fundraising events for the future, such as an exposition show at our local theatre in Brighton before it goes up to Scotland. 

 The impact of being in such a creative hub as Brighton and the University of Sussex has allowed all of us to experience new ways of experimenting, learning and developing our passion for theatre. We have all produced work we are proud of, and we are incredibly excited to present something we honestly, hand-on-heart think is an innovative piece of work, one which will fit in well in the internationally renowned Edinburgh Festival. 

The Edinburgh Fringe is one of the world’s best places to promote up and coming theatre talent. With so many cuts being made to the arts already, it’s harder than ever for students to obtain the funding they need from to promote their shows. Funding us would be your way of saying that you support emerging art and talent in Britain (and wouldn't that be nice!). 

Risks & Challenges 

Really there are not that many! Most of the administration for this play has already been done and we have a solid script with great actors who do justice to it.  All three members of the crew have written, produced and directed before, including being part of team at Brighton Fringe last year on much more complex productions than Toys.

 Other Ways You Can Help

 If you can't donate to us than we fully understand. However, if you like what we are doing and know someone who might like to donate then we would be so grateful if you had the time to share this via E-Mail, or Facebook or the Indigogo share tools. 

 Thank you for your time 

Jack and the Toys cast and crew
story_txt:
Short Summary 
This year SUDS (The University of Sussex Drama Society) will be sending the original play "Toys" to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival.
The clever clogs who have made this play are Jack BK, Gabriel Owen and Lucy Gray, all of whom have written, directed, produced, starred in and marketed their own plays before this. So we are quite the budding thespians (i.e. people who won’t cock it up). 
 The play goes as such: 
Miles and Katie wake up tied to chairs in the sound proof drum room of their comfy Kensington House. They think they are subject to an aggressive robbery until Darren, the typical 'benefits-street' lad, calmly walks down into the room and throws an accusation at Miles which, if true, will rip his life apart. 
Toys is a play that questions Britain's endless obsession with class. Its raw, stripped back energy and deconstruction of the everyday topics we face will force you to question issues of privilege, struggle and position in society. 

 What We Need & What You Get
 Being students this is obviously something we are unable to completely fund on our own. story:
Why do you go to parties? Do you act like yourself at parties? What do you get out of parties? Why do you dance?

These are just a few of the questions we're exploring with Here We Dance. 

Here We Dance is a devised immersive theatrical fairytale party featuring The Rooks and inspired by the Grimm's fairytale "The Twelve Dancing Princesses."

"Every night, the King locks his twelve daughters in their room, and every morning he discovers that their shoes are inexplicably worn through as if they've been dancing all night.... until the night a young Star Gazer who works in the palace garden follows the princesses through a trapdoor in hopes of uncovering their secret. Join the princesses and the Star Gazer on their journey into a magical world where trees are made of diamonds and the party never stops, and discover what happens when that world is threatened in this devised immersive theatrical fairytale party. "

TEAM

Director..........................................S. Dylan Zwickel
Producer.........................................Amanda Nelson
Music........................................................The Rooks
Choreographer..................................Haley Schwan
Stage Manager.................................Gab Nieporent
Scenic & Lighting Designer............Evan DelGaudio
Costume Designer.........................Jenna Weinstein
Graphic Designer...........................Sarah Weitzman 

CAST
Michelle Agresti
Laurel Andersen
Jess Cummings
Gina Doherty
Emily Hecht
Leah Henley
Emily Hunt
Christine Pardos
Heen Sasithorn
Haley Schwan
Russell Sperberg
Callan Suozzi-Rearic
Portland Thomas

We are featuring the band The Rooks as an integral aspect to our story. With soulful beats and inspiring melodies, The Rooks will inspire you to throw on your dancing shoes and move until they're worn through.

We've put together an incredible team to work on this project and are so excited about the prospect of having the world premiere on August 21st & 22nd, but...

We need your help to make our dream a reality!

Every penny donated will go towards this production. Our costs includes performance space, cast and creative team expenses, insurance, costumes, set, lights, and marketing. All essential elements to make this production a success. 

Here's a breakdown of our budget:

Our performance space was one of the biggest challenges we faced. We wanted a space large enough to create 5 distinct spaces to tell the story, and ideally one with a trap door. Sounds like we were asking a lot, right? Well, we found our dream space complete with trap door and everything we need to make our vision of the show a reality. We're booked to perform at Redwood Studios in Brooklyn! See the beautiful photos here: http://www.redwoodstudiosnewyork.com/. 

By donating, you'll become a part of this exciting process. You will also receive the perks outlined to the right and our deepest thanks and gratitude. 

Risks & Challenges

We've adapted a "go big or go home" mentality with this piece. Dylan (Director) and Amanda (Producer) have been talking about creating theater together for a while, but the right piece hadn't appeared yet. Dylan was inspired by this idea and we decided to hit the ground running and go full force. Why make theater if you aren't going to fully commit, right? We recognize that this is an ambitious piece, but we're passionate about the story and the themes and would love for you to partake in this journey with us. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We recognize that not everyone is in a position to donate. You can also help us out by spreading the word! Please share our Indiegogo with all of your friends and like our Facebook page. Most importantly, please support us by coming to see Here We Dance on August 21st & 22nd at Redwood Studios (55-C 9th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11215). Ticket information to follow.
